bestBHT.bht: Take heed and be on your guard, for the foretelling of coming calamities was meant to prepare and strengthen the believers. The warning was not exhausted in the first century, as it is a timeless reminder that our weakness should not be nourished by indifference. With sufficient notice and warning, we shall never be lacking in strength to resist. The omniscient nature of God is revealed in the words, behold, I have told you before, as they serve as a timely reminder of His divine knowledge.

Albert Barnes: Behold, I have told you before."
The reason why he told them before was that they might be on their guard, and be prepared for those calamities.
John Calvin: Lo, I have foretold it to you.
It is sufficient that we have received timely warning that such is his pleasure.
We shall never be in want of strength to resist, provided that our weakness be not nourished by indifference.
Philip Schaff: Matthew 24:25. Told you before hand. (Mark 13:23, ‘But take ye heed.’) A warning which can scarcely have been exhausted in the first century.
John Gill: Behold, I have told you before."
So that they had sufficient notice and warning of them."

bhtAttempts.bht: Take heed and be on your guard, for the verse in question is a warning that has not been exhausted in the first century. The foretelling of the coming calamities was meant to prepare and strengthen the believers, for as it was said, we shall never be in want of strength to resist, provided that our weakness be not nourished by indifference. The omniscient nature of God is revealed in the words, behold, I have told you before, showing that they had sufficient notice and warning of what was to come.

Take heed and be on your guard, for the foretelling of coming calamities was meant to prepare and strengthen the believers. The warning was not exhausted in the first century, as it is a timeless reminder that our weakness should not be nourished by indifference. With sufficient notice and warning, we shall never be lacking in strength to resist. The omniscient nature of God is revealed in the words, behold, I have told you before, as they serve as a timely reminder of His divine knowledge.

Be on your guard and take heed, for the forewarning of coming calamities serves as a timeless reminder for believers. By receiving timely notice and warning, we are equipped with the strength to resist. Our weakness should not be nurtured by indifference but instead be fueled by vigilance. The omniscient nature of God is demonstrated through the words, behold, I have told you before, revealing His divine knowledge and ensuring that we are never caught off guard.

Take heed and be on your guard, for the foretelling of coming calamities is a timeless reminder. With sufficient notice and warning, believers are equipped with strength to resist. Our weakness should not be nourished by indifference, but rather, we should be fueled by vigilance. The omniscient nature of God is revealed in the words, behold, I have told you before, emphasizing His divine knowledge that ensures we are never caught off guard.

Take heed and be on your guard, for the foretelling of coming calamities is a timely reminder that believers should not overlook. With sufficient notice and warning, our strength to resist remains unshaken. We must avoid nurturing our weakness through indifference and instead fuel it with constant vigilance. The omniscience of God is evident in the words, behold, I have told you before, showing His divine knowledge and assuring that we are never taken by surprise.
